fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.connector

Interface IPlatformAuthnService

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IAttachable, IAuthnService, IConnectorService, IPasswordAuthnService

    public interface IPlatformAuthnService
extends IPasswordAuthnService, IConnectorService
    An authentication service that delegates to an OpenAGE server.

    Use this service when OpenAGE is responsible for authentication, either using its built-in user directory or via LDAP (we do not need to connect ViewShell to LDAP when that connection is already managed by OpenAGE).

    Thread safety: implementations are required to be safe for concurrent read/write access.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies
    See Also:
    IPlatformConnector.getAuthenticationService()

      • authenticate

        ITicket authenticate(IUser user,
                     char[] userPassword)
        Authenticates an OpenAGE user, using a password.

        Note: for security reasons, the password must be specified as a char[] (and not as a String) to improve protection of user credentials. The authentication service should overwrite all characters in the password array as soon as it has been used, to reduce the risk of malicious third-party software retrieving it using memory-scanning techniques.

        Parameters:
        user - the user to authenticate, retrieved from the user directory of the OpenAGE server used to perform this authentication request.
        userPassword - the user's password. DO NOT STORE OR TRY TO RE-USE THIS!
        Returns:
        a ticket for the supplied user, if authentication succeeds, or null. Failure causes are not revealed (for security reasons).
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IPasswordAuthnService.authenticate(String, char[]), IPlatformConnector.getDirectoryService()

      • authenticateWithTrust

        ITicket authenticateWithTrust(IUser user)
                       throws AuthnException
        Authenticates an OpenAGE user, with a configured secret key shared with the OpenAGE platform server.

        This feature requires configuration of a shared secret key by both the client (this application) or the server (the OpenAGE platform server). It designed to be used in Single Sign-On environments where access to both the client and server is guarded by a third-party authentication system and where one-time passwords cannot be generated (for example, when a user should connect directly to the ViewShell platform without first connecting to the OpenAGE platform).

        Parameters:
        user - the user to authenticate, retrieved from the user directory of the OpenAGE server used to perform this authentication request.
        Returns:
        a ticket for the matching user, if authentication succeeds, or null. Failure causes are not revealed (for security reasons).
        Throws:
        AuthnException - if either the client (this application) or the server (the OpenAGE platform server) has no configured shared secret key. This is exception is not thrown when the server and client have configured incompatible secret keys.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        authenticateWithTrust(String)

      • authenticateWithTrust

        ITicket authenticateWithTrust(String userPrincipal)
                       throws AuthnException
        Authenticates an OpenAGE user, with a configured secret key shared with the OpenAGE platform server.
        Parameters:
        userPrincipal - user's login identifier.
        Returns:
        a ticket for the matching user, if authentication succeeds, or null. Failure causes are not revealed (for security reasons).
        Throws:
        AuthnException - if either the client (this application) or the server (the OpenAGE platform server) has no configured shared secret key. This is exception is not thrown when the server and client have configured incompatible secret keys.
        Since:

        See Also:
        authenticateWithTrust(IUser)

      • authenticateWithToken

        ITicket authenticateWithToken(IUser user,
                              String oneTimePassword)
        Authenticates an OpenAGE user, using a one-time password token supplied by the OpenAGE platform server.

        This is not the user's password, is not a shared secret key, and may be used only once. The server may impose a time limit for using this token.

        This feature enables the OpenAGE platform server to link to a customized user interface implemented with ViewShell, without requiring the user to sign on again. This implies that the user is already authenticated by the OpenAGE platform server.

        Parameters:
        user - the user to authenticate, retrieved from the user directory of the OpenAGE server used to perform this authentication request.
        oneTimePassword - the non-null authentication token provided by the platform server, for example as a URL parameter.
        Returns:
        a ticket for the matching user, if authentication succeeds, or null. Failure causes are not revealed (for security reasons).
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        authenticateWithToken(String, String)

      • authenticateWithToken

        ITicket authenticateWithToken(String userPrincipal,
                              String oneTimePassword)
        Authenticates an OpenAGE user, using a one-time password token supplied by the OpenAGE platform server.

        This is not the user's password, is not a shared secret key, and may be used only once. The server may impose a time limit for using this token.

        This feature enables the OpenAGE platform server to link to a customized user interface implemented with ViewShell, without requiring the user to sign on again. This implies that the user is already authenticated by the OpenAGE platform server.

        Parameters:
        userPrincipal - user's login identifier.
        oneTimePassword - the non-null authentication token provided by the platform server, for example as a URL parameter.
        Returns:
        a ticket for the matching user, if authentication succeeds, or null. Failure causes are not revealed (for security reasons).
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        authenticateWithToken(IUser, String)

      • getPlatformAuthnToken

        String getPlatformAuthnToken(ITicket ticket)
                      throws AuthnException
        Gets a single-use token, enabling a client (already authenticated for the current application) to authenticate automatically with the OpenAGE platform server that provided the ticket.

        The client (normally, the user's browser) can submit this token to the OpenAGE server's /connect/:principal/:token HTTP API (normally, as an AJAX request) to initiate a new (authenticated) HTTP session. The path variables "principal" and "token" should be URI-encoded as path segments.

        To request HTTP redirection when submitting the token, a request parameter (named "go") can be appended to the request's query string. This must start with a forward slash, and can refer to any arbitrary OpenAGE URL to which it would be useful to redirect the client.

        Given the single-use nature of this token, it should only be requested immediately before it is intended to be used. Avoid generating links directly containing the token where the user could attempt to follow such links after already having used it by following another link.

        Furthermore, each invocation of this method may involve communication between the current application and the OpenAGE platform server, and is therefore may be relatively slow (relative to processing capacity and network capacity).

        Parameters:
        ticket - a valid ticket, granted by this authentication service.
        Returns:
        the single-use token. Note that the same token may be returned multiple times if not already used.
        Throws:
        AuthnException - if the platform connection token cannot be derived from the specified token.
        Since:
        1.0
